fields.data:
Text field Properties:
⦿help - explain input pattern and purpose. can be displayed on ❔ button click
⦿default - value on initial display
⦿readonly - disable input from the user
⦿required - when set to ture, input must be provided (empty string is not allowed) 
⦿validation - a regular expression that the input must obey
⦿placeholder - Disappears on user input
fields.name: info_msg_text_options

fields.default: Click the help button to reveal field's pattern
fields.help: Field-1 input should start with 'Text-1' followed by one letter
fields.name: text_field1

fields.default: Click the help button to reveal field's pattern
fields.help: Field-2 input should contain only numbers
fields.name: text_field2

fields.default: You don't have to fill me
fields.help: Field-3 is not a mandatory field, hence, it can be sumbited empty
fields.name: text_field3

fields.help: Field-4 is a disabled, presetted field
fields.name: text_field4

fields.help: Field-5 has placeholder field
fields.name: text_field5
fields.placeholder: this placeholder will disappear on user input

fields.name: text_field_json
fields.default:
{
  "display": "Field-1",
  "default": "Click the help button to reveal field's pattern",
  "help": "Field-1 input should start with 'Text-1' followed by one letter",
  "name": "text_field1",
  "type": "text",
  "validation": "^Text-1[A-Za-z]+"
},
{
  "display": "Field-2",
  "default": "Click the help button to reveal field's pattern",
  "help": "Field-2 input should contain only numbers",
  "name": "text_field2",
  "type": "text",
  "validation": "^[0-9]+$"
},
{
  "display": "Field-3",
  "default": "You don't have to fill me",
  "help": "Field-3 is not a mandatory field, hence, it can be sumbited empty",
  "name": "text_field3",
  "required": false,
  "type": "text"
},
{
  "display": "Field-4",
  "default": "Some fixed input",
  "help": "Field-4 is a disabled, presetted field",
  "name": "text_field4",
  "readonly": true,
  "type": "text"
},
{
  "display": "Field-5",
  "help": "Field-5 has placeholder field",
  "name": "text_field5",
  "placeholder": "this placeholder will disappear on user input",
  "type": "text"
}

fields.data:
Password field Properties:
⦿help - explain input pattern and purpose. can be displayed on ❔ button click
⦿default - value on initial display
⦿readonly - disable input from the user
⦿required - when set to ture, input must be provided (empty string is not allowed)
fields.name: info_msg_password_options

fields.help: Password-1 give access to system 'X', it should obey the pattern: minimum eight characters, at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number and one special character
fields.name: password_field1

fields.help: Password-1 give access to system 'Y',  it should obey the pattern: only numbers. password-1 is also not a mandatory field, hence, empty string is allowed
fields.name: password_field2

fields.help: Field-3 is a fixed password with the value of 'password123'
fields.name: password_field4
password_field_json
fields.default:
{
  "display": "Password-1",
  "default": "",
  "help": "Password-1 give access to system 'X', it should obey the pattern: minimum eight characters, at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number and one special character",
  "name": "password_field1",
  "type": "password",
  "required": true,
  "validation": "^(?=.*[A-Za-z])(?=.*\d)[A-Za-z\d]{8,}$"
},
{
  "display": "Password-2",
  "default": "123456",
  "help": "Password-1 give access to system 'Y',  it should obey the pattern: only numbers, also it is not mandatory, i.e. empty string is allowed",
  "name": "password_field2",
  "type": "password",
  "validation": "^[1-9]"
},
{
  "display": "Password-3",
  "default": "password",
  "help": "Field-3 is a fixed password, with the value 'password'",
  "name": "password_field4",
  "readonly": true,
  "type": "password"
}
